snippet.textDisplay:
Bought Elden Ring on a whim (and bc I thought I'd hate them since i get crazy frustrated when i die in games (and in irl too)...

Only took about an hour for me to get hooked. I legit havent had this feeling about a gaming franchise since way back in the OLDEN days with Bethesda games (Fallout 3, Skyrim, New Vegas, etc). 
Have about 100 hours in the game and havent even beat the main story yet. Just a CRAZY amount of stuff to do and excellent world building. Now I decided i want to try the dark souls games since i never experienced them before. Starting with Dark Souls 1 (Remastered) and plan to continue the franchise. 

Maybe before i finally beat Elden Ring 🥴

snippet.textDisplay: It's occurred to me, fans were just salty because fromsoft made people pay £30 for this, and removed the shitty PTDE off of steam. PTDE was so bad, framerate capped to 30, resolution locked to 720p, the game was unoptimized, need I say more, you needed to mod the game to fix it, and even then, DSfix wasn't easy to install. Dark souls remastered just works right off the bat, you can run at higher resolutions, the game has a high refresh rate option, so running at 144hz for example, looks smoother even though the game is still capped to 60fps. they improved things like the lighting and effects, thing like bonfires, spells, fire, all look really good and, especially the bonfire, they look cozy and have a warm glow. They added a password system for multiplayer, which was a great change. Dark souls remastered is the port we needed.

snippet.textDisplay: I played the original Dark Souls on PS3.  The key to keeping blight Town from lagging is to kill every enemy.  Don't sneak past them, kill them.  If you kill all the enemies it doesn't lag bad.  If you sneak past them, you get so many enemies at the same time the processor gets bogged down.
snippet.textOriginal: I played the original Dark Souls on PS3.  The key to keeping blight Town from lagging is to kill every enemy.  Don't sneak past them, kill them.  If you kill all the enemies it doesn't lag bad.  If you sneak past them, you get so many enemies at the same time the processor gets bogged down.

snippet.textDisplay:
Completed Elden Ring, Sekiro and Dark Souls III before any hardcore FromSoft fans start ranting.

Worst Souls type game I have played yet. No competition... 

Controls are clunky, weapon hit boxes from both Player and Enemy make no sense, The majority of the game is spent being a platformer, weapons constantly break, you don't get fast travel until half way through the game so you have to run ages back to the black smith to upgrade/fix your gear.

The game isn't "Hard" it is just unfair and there is a fine line between Hard and Unfair. 

Its made me quite sad because I really tried my best to like this game and it infuriates me that people say this is the best Souls type game when it just isn't, I honestly think that people say that because of the Nostalgia effect. I am very easily pleased and this game did nothing of the sort.

snippet.textDisplay:
I wish that a division of Fromsoft would remaster the old games but add arcade like content. For anyone who plays resident evil games there are so many modes and mini games after completing the main campaign multiply replay value.

One possible example would be to improve the physics, graphics and overall experience, then add in an updated combat system like in Elden Ring. Ie better dual wielding, infusing, ash of war (call it something else) and spells. Update the enemy AI to go from normal to mental. Create arcade challenges in ng+. Defeating x number of npcs in x amount of time. Defeat x number of npcs without being seen. Etc. It pushes peoples abilities and expectations. Perhaps another section has an archery range with timed rounds. Either way you get to push old content to greater heights whilst giving it a makeover.

snippet.textDisplay: The OG Dark Souls will always hold that special place. Games like Elden Ring are MUCH MUCH MUCH bigger with way more variety, tons of QOL improvements, smoother mechanics, etc etc, but there's just something genuinely special about the OG, it's the only one I keep wanting to replay over and over. The other games I'll run through once and maybe do a NG+ or two, but with DS1 I always like starting totally fresh and seeing how fast I can clear it. I bought the remaster for the 60 FPS alone, the other perks are just gravy!
snippet.textOriginal: The OG Dark Souls will always hold that special place. The other games I'll run through once and maybe do a NG+ or two, but with DS1 I always like starting totally fresh and seeing how fast I can clear it. I bought the remaster for the 60 FPS alone, the other perks are just gravy!

snippet.textDisplay: Hey, so as a guy who loves these types of games, I really want to get into the dark souls franchise. I love the concept and love the grinding concept of this game, but I know absolutely nothing about these games. I have never played or read a piece of the dark souls franchise. I want that to change, so I figured why not start out from the latest to the newest. Before I do thought, is this the first ever dark souls game? And if so, what should I expect throughout the entire franchise?

snippet.textDisplay: I like DS1 better than DS3. The combat is smoother and the maps are well designed. I especially like the Anor Londor map. The windows are clear so that you can see the scenery through the windows. The interior design of the castle also feels more delicate than DS3. I know that DS3 tries to depict a end of world era, while in DS1 the undead curses just emerges.
snippet.textOriginal: I like DS1 better than DS3. The combat is smoother and the maps are well designed. I especially like the Anor Londor map. The windows are clear so that you can see the scenery through the windows. The interior design of the castle also feels more delicate than DS3. I know that DS3 tries to depict a end of world era, while in DS1 the undead curses just emerges.

Just completed my first DS remaster run with Black Knight Halberd. (greetings from 2021 :) Surprisingly one of the most challenging bosses to me was Wise Demon (as well as Stray Demon) and also Manus hehe)

snippet.textDisplay: dark souls 2 is my first game,. I'm playing DS remastered now on PC and I must say the PC port is a big improvement over PTD edition in terms of controls. (and i haven't done any soul glitch yet, just good ol' farming)

snippet.textDisplay: Just ordered this. I've had vanilla Dark Souls on Xbox 360 for years, but it wasn't until recently that I learned that the Remastered version has the DLC that I never got to play, so I ordered it. 60fps should also be a nice upgrade compared to what I'm used to. It also looks like the fire in Remastered actually looks like fire as opposed to the ugly streaks on neon orange in the 360 version.
snippet.textOriginal: Just ordered this. I've had vanilla Dark Souls on Xbox 360 for years, but it wasn't until recently that I learned that the Remastered version has the DLC that I never got to play, so I ordered it. 60fps should also be a nice upgrade compared to what I'm used to. It also looks like the fire in Remastered actually looks like fire as opposed to the ugly streaks on neon orange in the 360 version.

snippet.textDisplay:
I finally got around to playing and finishing this for the first time and let me tell you, this is an experience. I've played many different games over the years and am kinda jaded, but I've been unable to put this one down since I started. It's challenging but if you stick to it, it'll give you a sense of accomplishment like no other.


Anyone thinking of playing Dark Souls I recommend going in blind and figure things out by yourself. It's so rewarding when you finally conquer it.

snippet.textDisplay: If you like this game you have a serious ego problem because you are trying to be "mr hotshot" and "mr hardcore gamer" please give it a rest. Anyone could beat this game if they put in the time to memorize the areas and grind their way to victory. First off the voice acting is horrific, I could have done a more believable job than their hired voice actors, its laughable how bad the voice acting is. Also, the game atmosphere is all dark and lonely. No fun or excitement to be had here. The graphics suck and I dont know why people keep saying they are good and the interface reminds me of old NES or SNES games, sorry I will pass on crappy old japanese video game feel in the year 2012. I would rather play a game like Skyrim or Red Dead Redemption where the voice acting is amazing and the world is beautiful and wonderful stories are told. Speaking of story......there is NONE in DS. You run around facing mindless enemies who just come straight at you and swing. Not dynamic whatsoever. This game makes you think its open world but really its not because if you try a certain area you will quickly realize your supposed to "grind" more to get there and then come back later when you have leveled more and it will be easy to defeat the enemies. Some people claim this is how you know you have come along and gotten better. No this is not skill. This is memorization and learning. Your attributes are now better because you grinded. Doesnt mean you are good. Like I said people only like this because they want to feel like they are talented video game players, again WRONG you are just the only losers who waste the time to sit and memorize and replay areas over and over and over. If you want to prove your skill go play MLG halo or starcraft and then come talk to me. I have played in two MLG halo tournaments and have never placed higher than top 84 out of 200 teams and I dominate every multiplayer game I have ever played and have beaten every game I have ever played on the hardest difficulty. Dark Souls is just a terribly made game and one thing I am really sick of reading about is the "great" game design here. This is about the laziest game design I have ever seen. I am all about challenge like the next guy but they dont even teach you how to play the damn game. Everyone is like "thats the beauty they throw you in and you have to figure it out" no thats called lazy design. I need to learn how to play the damn game and I shouldnt have to look at online guides to help me. They teach you a few little things and thats it. Even basic inventory management is not taught. Would you call an Mixed Martial Arts coach good if you walked in and he taught you about wrestling and then threw you into a fight without teaching you any of the other facets of MMA? Of course not you would get your head ripped off standing up and would blame him for not teaching you. But apparently teaching you a few concepts in this game while you figure out this rest is "great" game design. Am I in college now? Where I just teach myself? No thats why we pay you for your game so you teach us how to play it. In review DS is a horrific game and I am telling you DO NOT but this game and if you buy it for the challenge and to brag I am here to tell you that you are not a skilled gamer just because you beat it so get off your high horse. Please stop. Like I said go play MLG and then come back and tell me how good you are. Any lemming can sit and memorize and grind and beat mindless horribly implemented NPCs. Beat SMART human players...now that takes skill. Re doing areas again and again to learn and level up is how you win in DS. Thats not skillful. Mindless spamming magic spells and blocking and evading dont make for amazing or skillful combat.

snippet.textDisplay: I dont understand how everyone can be blind to the fact that this is now the first portable dark souls game. Remember when portable devices were so underpowered compared to modern consoles that the gameboy advanced was basically the equivalent of a super Nintendo at the time that the gamecube came out? Now we have a triple a game (or double a? Not sure which this game counts as) playing on a console that fits in your palms. Add to the fact that the game has been updated graphically and I would say that's enough for a remaster. When someone remasters music it just means you updated the sound with higher definition, maybe added in stereo etc. No one expects the album to be a complete re recording of the entire album. It's just RE "mastered" not remade entirely. I think this is probably just another case of a fanbase creating false expectations of a game and being disappointed when it doesnt make every change they wanted and then when developers do actually change the games they'd complain that it's not the same as the original. I'm starting to come to the conclusion that consumers dont know what they want and when they get what they claim they want it turns out to be unwanted.

snippet.textDisplay: Are you dense, Jake? This is not essentially the Prepare To Die Edition. DS:PTD was locked at 30fps and a sub-1080p resolution. This remaster is a godsend for PC players who have been plagued with a shitty port and buggy mod fixes for so long.

snippet.textDisplay:
The controversy around this remaster is one of the dumbest things I've seen gamers drum up in a while.

So many complaints asking for things that would upset the meta of the game, or asking for things that fit better in remakes and not remasters.

On top of that the PC players whining they can get better with a few mods... Not only can you not mod busier servers into base DS1 on PC, but you're comparing apples to oranges. If you want to compare apples to apples compare the two launches in their unmodded fashion. The remaster is both cheaper, and better, and unlike the original launch it works out of the box. If you want to compare oranges to oranges then wait until the mod community gets to work on the remaster. The potential for improvements through mods on a game that actually works from the get go and looks good, is far better than the potential for mods on a game that released borderline broken and didn't look as good.

For those complaining they didn't get the upgrade for free... Put on your damn big boy pants. Just because you can get somebodies mods for free doesn't mean you're actually entitled to somebodies work for free. Keep going with this kind of narrative and you'll see even more companies shut down modding abilities for their games all together.
snippet.textOriginal:

If you want to compare apples to apples compare the two launches in their unmodded fashion. The remaster is both cheaper, and better, and unlike the original launch it works out of the box. If you want to compare oranges to oranges then wait until the mod community gets to work on the remaster. The potential for improvements through mods on a game that actually works from the get go and looks good, is far better than the potential for mods on a game that released borderline broken and didn't look as good.

For those complaining they didn't get the upgrade for free... Put on your damn big boy pants. Just because you can get somebodies mods for free doesn't mean you're actually entitled to somebodies work for free. Keep going with this kind of narrative and you'll see even more companies shut down modding abilities for their games all together.

snippet.textDisplay: I can see the value of buying the remaster if you're an Xbox or PS player.  60 fps,  improved visuals, and good servers are certainly a benefit. Though for PC players who use things like DS fix,  DSCM, and mods  The only thing I can see value in is the revived multiplayer. Personally I don't think that even with the discount of twenty dollars for owning the original is worth it as of now.  I'm sure there are a lot of people that disagree with me and that's fine.
snippet.textOriginal: I can see the value of buying the remaster if you're an Xbox or PS player.  60 fps,  improved visuals, and good servers are certainly a benefit. snippet.textDisplay:
This game is so epic for someone who never played (or finished) the original Dark Souls game on console.

I *LOVE* Bloodborne and Dark Souls 3, mainly because they're the first 2 Soulsborne games I ever played.  And even after reading so many comments that DS1 was better than DS2 and DS3, I didn't feel like reconnecting my PS3 to play an outdated Souls games with last gen graphics.

But now that it was remastered, IMHO the graphics are good!  They aren't DS3 quality, but they're very much acceptable and some areas do look like PS4 quality!

But it's all about the gameplay and the level design!  All those people that say DS1 was better than DS2 and DS3 are not BSing!  It's not just a nostalgia trip!  The whole concept of exploring upwards and downwards compared to DS3 and Bloodborne's level design is awesome.  I also kinda like how none of the bosses have phases or different forms.  To me, DS1 bosses feel easier and more relaxing than BB and DS3.  Cause when bosses have a 2nd phase/form, you gotta master all of it!  You could be struggling to get a boss to 50% and when you finally master it, the game slaps you in the face with a 2nd phase where the boss is now faster, has more ranged and deals more damage.  Then it can become a total nightmare to kill because you gotta keep playing perfectly for Phase 1 so you can reach Phase 2 and start practicing to master it!

But Dark Souls 1?  You just gotta master how to dodge, block and attack a boss within the first few minutes and then repeat that same strategy until it reaches 0% health.  I LOVE IT!!!   Dark Souls Prepare to Die?  More like... Dark Souls Prepare to Chillout if you already mastered Bloodborne and Dark Souls 3.

snippet.textDisplay: I know this is "game journalism" with zero standards, but the reviewer is too centrist and wish-washy. This "remaster" is a slap to the face of the fans, who expected, if not an overhaul, but at least the fix of the most outstanding bugs. We got none of that - the most game-breaking bugs are still here, Lost Izalith is still missing textures and models (with huge gaping holes instead), this is not a remaster - this is a lazy port.
snippet.textOriginal: I know this is "game journalism" with zero standards, but the reviewer is too centrist and wish-washy. This "remaster" is a slap to the face of the fans, who expected, if not an overhaul, but at least the fix of the most outstanding bugs. We got none of that - the most game-breaking bugs are still here, Lost Izalith is still missing textures and models (with huge gaping holes instead), this is not a remaster - this is a lazy port.

snippet.textDisplay:
I think it's a bit misleading to call the PC version just "Prepare to Die" again, as all the changes mentioned for the console builds are in the PC version as well, with the exception being Namco Bandai released a terrible port 6 years ago and expect owners of that port to pay the same full asking price for the remaster and removing the original from purchase along with banning mods from the remaster, essentially hurting the strong modding community the PC version had.
If you own a console or PC, buy the Remaster unless it's not an option for you (last gen, or Xbox One backwards compatibility if you don't want to pay for the Remaster) but if you own the original on PC, DO NOT BUY THE REMASTER or BUY IT WITH DARK SOULS II AND III BUNDLED TOGETHER ON INDIEGALA. Don't get suckered twice by Bandai Namco.
snippet.textOriginal:
I think it's a bit misleading to call the PC version just "Prepare to Die" again, as all the changes mentioned for the console builds are in the PC version as well, with the exception being Namco Bandai released a terrible port 6 years ago and expect owners of that port to pay the same full asking price for the remaster and removing the original from purchase along with banning mods from the remaster, essentially hurting the strong modding community the PC version had.
If you own a console or PC, buy the Remaster unless it's not an option for you (last gen, or Xbox One backwards compatibility if you don't want to pay for the Remaster) but if you own the original on PC, DO NOT BUY THE REMASTER or BUY IT WITH DARK SOULS II AND III BUNDLED TOGETHER ON INDIEGALA. Don't get suckered twice by Bandai Namco.

snippet.textDisplay: When Bloodborne was free with Ps Plus, I grabbed it and was immediately hooked. As a SoulsBorne virgin I was pretty scared at forst hahaha. But then I completed the game, got Platinum on it, completed the Old Hunters DLC and it jumped as one of my favorite games of all time. Then I gave myself an objective: get Platinum in all of the Dark Souls games. I grabbed DS2 SotFS and DS3 while they were on sale, and I pre-ordered DS Remastered. I can’t wait for the feeling when I get Platinum in all of those games. A true sense of pride and accomplishment!

snippet.textDisplay: I've been playing since the first Dark Souls, loved it so much I went played Demon Souls, and now I've played every game in the series. For those of you new to the series, I highly recommend you buy this game. Dark Souls 3 makes so many nods to the 1st game that you likely wouldn't have understood/caught them unless you had another player tell you. It is before a time where you could stand from one bonefire, and see the next, so be prepared for more of a challenge. Mostly, get your diddly hole ready for Dragon Slayer Ornstein and Executioner Smough. I have still have nightmares about the first time I did that fight.

snippet.textDisplay:
I've been really looking forward to finally get into the series.
I played Bloodborne, finished it... and absolutely loved it (and hated it, too lol) but I hadn't tried any of the DS games.
So I bought DS3 so I could finally jump into the series.
However, a few days after I bought it, the Remaster of THIS game was announced, and I thought "Well... shit. I guess I'll hold off on DS3 for the time being until DS1 comes out so I can get it and play it... and THEN play DS3 after I finished the first one lmao"

I wasn't planning on getting the second one since, apparently, it's the lesser one in the series, according to the fans.

snippet.textDisplay:
"If it ain't broke, don't fix it". Yes... Because the lack of Omnidirectional rolling wasn't broke, or the backstabbing exploits in PvP (and the many other bug exploits used *7 years ago* ), or the save glitching that hackers can do to fuck up your save file or get you banned. 

A lot of love and care? Bull, fucking, shit. To someone who hasn't/wasn't able to play the first game, this game is just right, but to someone who has played the first game, this game is a poor excuse of a remaster. 

It's not even a fucking remaster, it's a $20 graphics patch with Blight Town fixed.
snippet.textOriginal:

A lot of love and care? Bull, fucking, shit. To someone who hasn't/wasn't able to play the first game, this game is just right, but to someone who has played the first game, this game is a poor excuse of a remaster.

snippet.textDisplay:
Well... I know many people won't agree with me, but...
My favourite game was Dark Souls 2. It had some MAJOR defects like the Soul Memory system (that thing killed multiplayer entirely), but the character animations were more realistic compared to the other chapters of the saga.
My favourite boss? Fume Knight. I love every part of that fight, from the challenge to the mechanics. Clearing that boss was always a rewarding experience.
snippet.textOriginal:
Well... I know many people won't agree with me, but...
My favourite game was Dark Souls 2. It had some MAJOR defects like the Soul Memory system (that thing killed multiplayer entirely), but the character animations were more realistic compared to the other chapters of the saga.
My favourite boss? Fume Knight. I love every part of that fight, from the challenge to the mechanics. Clearing that boss was always a rewarding experience.

snippet.textDisplay:
I BOUGHT IT ON PC...
I have it already, and even had the DSFix (upped resolution and added 60FPS) and some texture mods. At first I was PISSED OFF and said this is crap as the game should have been like this from the start... and I mostly think that STILL...

However, after I started a new game I was surprised at how much better the TEXTURES and colors look. The clothing is nicer. The dungeon walls and LIGHTING especially just pops. As well there were issues in places with DSfix 60FPS before (but it was far preferable to 30FPS)... 

Apparently multi-player is improved too (added to the huge FPS drops in some places it's a massive difference) but I'm currently staying with single player (turned ONLINE OFF)... so I guess what I'm saying is that to ME it's worth it. I paid $25(CDN) so $20USD? as I had the original and since I know I'll play off and on for at least another year that's money well spent.

To summarize:
1) WORTH IT TO ME.
2) Still think it's crap the original didn't run like this (solid 60FPS, high res, better textures, better online)

snippet.textDisplay:
PC? £35 for an average patch, at most. Only worth it if you don't have it; and even then, it's buggier than the Old Version was before it got removed from Steam...

Console? Also only a patch, but you had NO option for 60fps before so there's that. However it's also only really worth it if you don't have it.

Jake's positive attitude is rightfully something you will not find in too many other places.

No matter how much nostalgia I have for the original I just can't recommend it currently. Unless you're desperate, wait for Sale.

snippet.textDisplay:
Before you buy: If you've never played Dark Souls or you've only played the original on consoles, buy it. 
If you had PTDE and want more consistent 60fps, some quality of life changes and don't mind spending 20 bucks, go ahead.
If you had PTDE and saw what a broken piece of shit port it was without the community fixing it and think that the official 1st PC patch for the game shouldn't cost you 20 bucks after 7 years, don't buy.
snippet.textOriginal:
Before you buy: If you've never played Dark Souls or you've only played the original on consoles, buy it. 
If you had PTDE and want more consistent 60fps, some quality of life changes and don't mind spending 20 bucks, go ahead.
If you had PTDE and saw what a broken piece of shit port it was without the community fixing it and think that the official 1st PC patch for the game shouldn't cost you 20 bucks after 7 years, don't buy.

snippet.textDisplay:
" Level Design, Smaller, Quaint, less twisty turny, less epic and gorgeous. "

Jake, I will have to disagree with you on that point. The Souls community as a whole agree that the interconnected level design of Dark Souls is far better than what DS2/3 have to offer. The sequels failed to recapture the marriage of the world around you because of poor level design. In dark souls 3 You couldnt even get a sense of scale until defeating the dancer gaining access to lothric castle then you begin to see over the world. Even in Irithyll you couldnt see the Profaned capital or the Carthus catacombs. In Dark Souls 1 from the very get go you see Undead Burg, Lower Undead Burg, Undead Parish, Darkroot Garden, they were all INTERTWINED. Not to mention the 'Safe Hub'. the Original Firelink never felt alive, even when you manage to crowd NPCs there. It always felt lonely. The Souls community found that Majula and Dark Souls 3 Firelink couldnt bring the haunting feeling of being an accursed undead, It was always safe in the sequel hubs unless you do a sidequest that prompts hostility, even then it still felt safe. Maybe it was the respawning NPCs that played a part to this broken immersion, anyway it wasnt Soulslike at all.

snippet.textDisplay:
If it ain't broken don't fix it? But it is broken, so they needed to fix it. Yet they did jack shit. Well no, that's not true, they did add some quality of life features like using multiple souls at once. I mean, lovingly remastered? Really? Porting the game to current gen consoles is considered lovingly remastered?

If you stop looking at it with rose colored glasses, just because its Dark Souls, and look at this -port- "remaster" objectively, it is lazy and no effort was put into it despite it being sold for 40 fucking dollars.

Just imagine how perfect the game would have ended up being if even a tiny bit of effort was put into it. Christ this is depressing... This is what the modern video game industry has become and not even good games are immune to this shit.

snippet.textDisplay: My issue with the souls series has always been in regards to poor control and flawed gameplay. It should be difficult because it requires skill, which to be fair it does, but it requires much more luck. The controls are clunky and poor, where a roll can easily kill you because you stopped on an edge the AI didn't know how to stand on. That, or the insane and arbitrary hitboxes on larger enemies. Hell, even the random hits against the PC that should never have been counted, and yet kill you. You can't let that stuff happen in a game where two hits mean death and a huge loss of progress.
snippet.textOriginal: My issue with the souls series has always been in regards to poor control and flawed gameplay. It should be difficult because it requires skill, which to be fair it does, but it requires much more luck. The controls are clunky and poor, where a roll can easily kill you because you stopped on an edge the AI didn't know how to stand on. That, or the insane and arbitrary hitboxes on larger enemies. Hell, even the random hits against the PC that should never have been counted, and yet kill you. You can't let that stuff happen in a game where two hits mean death and a huge loss of progress.

snippet.textDisplay:
Be warned, multiplayer on PC might be risky as of now.
A known hacker and cheat engine exploiter of past Souls games has been going around with modified spells and killing innocent players instantly in DS remastered.
The modified spell is a fireball that's been made to have abnormally large range and hitbox, abnormally high damage, and inflicts a myriad of status debuffs like curse and what not that are hard to remove, especially for new players.
This guy has been streaming his use of the cheat engine so it's not just rumors.
Just a PSA for any prospective PC buyers, be careful and don't let these kinds of guys ruin your Souls experience.
snippet.textOriginal:
Be warned, multiplayer on PC might be risky as of now.

Just a PSA for any prospective PC buyers, be careful and don't let these kinds of guys ruin your Souls experience.

snippet.textDisplay: I think people are missing the point of this remaster. It's mostly just so you can play it at 60 frames per second. Yes and for pc players who use mods (which are almost all of pc players) to get 60 fps, this version feels really cheap even for $20. But for everybody on consoles this remaster is a good purchase. It also goes without saying if you have never played dark souls 1 before, you definitely want this version over the old one.

snippet.textDisplay: there is 1 major issue with the way the game is coded. if your pc cant run it at steady 60 fps through everything. if it drops even a tiny bit, your game slows down. 30 fps = game runs at 50% speed. my pc could run it at 60 fps, but for some reason after 2-5 mins depending on where i was, it would drop and would only get back to 60 if i reloaded the save or respawned.

snippet.textDisplay: I feel alone in saying this, but I prefer DS3 more than the original. I can still see where people are coming from, and yes it's still a good game by all means, but coming back from the third game to the original, I just found DS3 a more satisfying journey to play. I thought its bosses were the best in the series, the environments, while they lacked the original's vibrant colours, were beautiful and the multiplayer aspect made me love it both as a single player and multiplayer experience. The first one I feel is a little dated in some areas and some of the bosses are quite clunky. This doesn't mean all of them are bad, not at all, but there's quite a few of them that feel weird and frustrating to fight, and not in the good Dark Souls way of frustrating. Overall that's why I enjoy DS3 more than the original. But that's just my opinion, so eh. Be sure to hate me with your replies.
snippet.textOriginal: I feel alone in saying this, but I prefer DS3 more than the original. I can still see where people are coming from, and yes it's still a good game by all means, but coming back from the third game to the original, I just found DS3 a more satisfying journey to play. I thought its bosses were the best in the series, the environments, while they lacked the original's vibrant colours, were beautiful and the multiplayer aspect made me love it both as a single player and multiplayer experience. The first one I feel is a little dated in some areas and some of the bosses are quite clunky. This doesn't mean all of them are bad, not at all, but there's quite a few of them that feel weird and frustrating to fight, and not in the good Dark Souls way of frustrating. Overall that's why I enjoy DS3 more than the original. But that's just my opinion, so eh. Be sure to hate me with your replies.

snippet.textDisplay: From what I understand of the situation this is comparable to the assassin's creed rogue remaster, not much was done other than some graphical improvements and in this games case revitalization of the pvp. Now I'm not here to argue the merit of if you should buy this remaster or not solely on those merits. I DO however recommend buying this game if you haven't played dark souls yet. I've only played the original version of dark souls on my xbox one via backwards compatability and even then I only got to the shadow armor in blight town a couple months back and haven't touched it since. Even then i can tell that ds1 is a really good, challenging game. And while some may not agree with how this remaster was handled, if this is (for the most part) the best version of ds1 then it's probably the one you should buy if you want to get into it. I plan to buy this sometime in the near future myself because fuck me the frame rate for the original game on console is killing me. It's not a must buy because I'm saving for various things but it this is a future buy for me.

snippet.textDisplay:
I'm just going to be basing my opinion on the three Dark Souls games (because I haven't finished Demon's Souls and have yet to touch Bloodborne)

Dark Souls 1 was the best for world design (by this I mean the lore, art design, and level design). The other games are far more linear in design and the areas/lore feel less inspired than those found in the first.

Dark Souls 2 was the best for what you were capable of doing as the player. The combat was certainly the most diverse with it having more weapon types than the other two and them not holding back in designing spells. You can also spell buff just about any weapon in the game while also having an infusion on it. The power stance mechanic also added to this variety and was far better than the weapon art system featured in Dark Souls 3.

Dark Souls 3 was, for obvious reasons, the best for graphical quality and generally had the most quality of life features. These including: the ability to offer more than one item at a time to a covenant, charging heavy attacks, auto-repair at bonfires, the ability to swap covenants at nearly any given time, consuming multiple items at once, a quick use item bar that appears under the menu bar, password matchmaking, stick jumping, and making the upgrade system as simple as possible (now of course these weren't all introduced in Dark Souls 3, some first appeared in Dark Souls 2, but they appear along with the features thay did unlike Dark Souls 2).

So Dark Souls 1 has the best world, Dark Souls 2 had the best combat, and Dark Souls 3 had the best quality of life features and graphics. Dark Souls 1 is probably my favorite though, but they're all pretty close for me anyway, so I could almost go whatever way.

I'll give a short summary on whether you should buy this "remaster" 

You never played Dark Souls or the DLC = Get it
You want to experience the multiplayer resurgence = Get it
You want an improved single player experience = Don't get it
You want a good graphical improvement over the 1st = Don't get it
You want a Bug free Dark Souls 1 experience = Don't get it
You are short on cash but you really like SoulsBorne = Go look for the Solaire amiibo   
You have too much money and don't really care = You do you
You want the Switch version = We all do. 

This is a completely pathetic remaster but it is still a FANTASTIC game. \[T]/

snippet.textDisplay:
Actual review from an actual fan: 

CONS:
They removed a lot of pvp mechanics. 
They killed all the existing mods for the game.
They turned the saturation all the way down for no reason.
They changed the fire animations from the iconic hand-drawn flames to a basic flame asset from Unity.
The game is still unbalanced as hell.
There have been 0 changes towards making casting builds viable.(They even nerfed how WOTG works, instead of its high spamy damage.)
They penalty of leaving a faction has been scraped making faction loyalty non-existent.

PROS:
The community is back.
You can consume multiples of an item at once.
I bet there will soon be a mod that reverts all the visual changes so I am looking forward to that.

snippet.textDisplay:
As a long time dark souls player this remaster is just the dsfix mod tbh, having over 2k hours on the first dank souls I'm kinda disappointed they didn't actually do much like scholar of the first sin (DS2 rerelease for this gens console) I expected more from Fromsoft. I agree that this should be payed for unlike others who say they should get it free of they owned (which I also understand in this case) but 40$ for what they know was a major hit for consoles (which most sane people played it  on console) but only reduced price on steam is much of a bummer. (I bought ds1 3 times on Xbox dlc too, once tho obviously, DS2 and all dlc and DS2:STFS, and DS3 + GOTY edition) it just bums me out that there was no real significant difference for me, other than a live community again but I had that already since I played at it's prime (gravelord covenant tho 😂😂). I don't think I should pay 40 for something that isn't like DS2:STFS imo
However for newcomers this is the best possible version you can get and highly encourage you play this if you have not.
snippet.textOriginal:

(I bought ds1 3 times on Xbox dlc too, once tho obviously, DS2 and all dlc and DS2:STFS, and DS3 + GOTY edition) it just bums me out that there was no real significant difference for me, other than a live community again but I had that already since I played at it's prime (gravelord covenant tho 😂😂). I don't think I should pay 40 for something that isn't like DS2:STFS imo
However for newcomers this is the best possible version you can get and highly encourage you play this if you have not.
